The correct answer is A: Because volumetric rendering is costly, and after projecting to 2D the method can still maintain good view consistency during rendering around a query pixel.

In the audio, it is mentioned that NePu performs rendering directly in 2D after projecting features and keypoints because volumetric rendering is costly. The method can still maintain good view consistency during rendering around a query pixel by projecting to 2D. This approach allows for efficient rendering while preserving the quality of the results.
